author: A_Brickset_user
title: A nice castle, but....
review:
At one time this was a highly prized set for me.  Then it dawns on you...what kind of alternate models can I make with this?! If there's anything that degrades a castle, it's one of those stupid chunky baseplates.  It throws out the window any idea of linking this castle up with another one.  

Another down point to this set is the inferior castle figures, which aren't as good as the previous 80's castle figures.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: k...k..k...kerosene!
review:
Lovely set! 
PROS: 
All the shields! With the excellent black monarch design.
The bardings have nice designs.
Nice assortment of side-plumes.
The design of this castle is nice, like a protected courtyard rather than just a wall or a keep-in-bailey.
The well is good, rather unique. Helps the "courtyard" feel.
Lovely red rooves.
CONS: The helmet colours and types on the foot soldiers and archers is a bit too varied.
EXCELLENT OVERALL!!

author: A_Brickset_user
title: The Best castle set of all Time
review: This set is awesome, it has everything a good castle needs. The tudor gives a sense of being a castle rather than a fort that most castle sets seem to lack. The figures are cool, especially the armored knights.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Wonderful castle
review: This is a really wonderful castle!  The various towers make excellent places for archers, and there's two knights in full armor.  This large castle has lots of minifigs, enough for a small army of defense!  There's a dungeon inside the castle -- there's a raised baseplate for just this.  Comes with a whole slew of pieces too!  Overall, this castle is a ton of fun and is a perfect addition to the castle theme.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Sheer Anniliation
review:
BACK AGAIN
second review,

I gave it a ten because of thr sheer amount of minifigs,GREAT design(unlike Royal Knight's Castle,
Still in my opinion is a cut below Royal Knight's Castle even though it is probally better.
PEACE

author: A_Brickset_user
title: a lot of shields and....
review: flags so you can obiously tell it is a Black Dragons set.....i liked that lego included a lot of minifigs...the baseplate is perfect for building alterinitve modes....My brother made a castle out of 112 pieces and it is perfect....so make a castle out of 112 pieces and it is at least a 9.5

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Still love it
review: I've had this set for over 12 years now and I still hae all of the original pieces. This was one of my first lego sets and one of my favorites. The amount of minifigs and the durability makes it one of the best in its class.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: The greatest castle in Lego History
review:
What a perfect castle set!!! I have just bought it from  internet, this is a nice castle set imitates a real castle which is built on a mountain. It contains 11 nice minifigs and 1 ghost. Nice baseplate and nice construction. Including 2 nice horse bardings with dragon pattern. The shields for the knights are also great..big and beautiful. One more, the pattern of the flags is painted by pigment, not a sticker...on nowadays, most of the lego sets prefer use sticker rather that the pigment...
Well, it's a classic castle set that is worth to purchase and never be missing it...

author: A_Brickset_user
title: the best Lego castle ever
review: Well what can I say?  It's the best Lego castle ever made, and perhaps the best Lego castle set ever made too.  Admittedly, I don't own all the others but I think it's a safe bet.  The number of minifigures is great, and the fact that you get FOUR decked out knights on horses is even better, and then there is a ghost.  Maybe a princess or peasent would have made it perfect, but I'm perfectly satisfied with what's there.  There are lots of useful pieces, and the drawbridge/gate is great.  I also like the ramp out the back.  What are really nice are the tudor wall pieces that are unique to this set (I think).  I think the towers are a little weird because the minifigs stand so low, but then they are shielded better that way.  Overall a fantastic set, and a centerpiece to any Lego Castle collection.

author: lordjim13
title: Nice Looking Castle
review: But ultimately hollow.  It is a vast improvement over Kings Mountain Fortress (6081), and looks good from the angle on the box cover, but the back is weak.  However, it has nice features like the new portculis and the postern ramp door, and a good number of figures.  Even though I was a lion guy, and needed grey bricks, I had to get this one.  Not as good as the old classics, but better than anything else since...

author: horak
title: The Ultimate Lego Castle. Period.
review: Nothing can compare to this Lego Castle set.  The barding, the minifigs, tudor walls, colors and the design make this Castle set the best ever.  Contrary to the views of some, the set is expandable in spite of the raised baseplate; you just need the right bricks and it is doable.  I'm so glad that I have this set (well, actually 4 of them!)

author: bcrookston
title: Black Knight's Castle
review:
Anyone can see that this set is incredible.  One of the many great things about it is the various creative building techniques.  Nothing special, but when it came out it was pretty unique. Love the yellow castle walls and the various doors. 

My first big castle and I still love it.  It is too bad that the white dragon plumes are so rare, wouldn't mind having several more sets.

author: Novelty
title: Jack Black
review: This is another big castle built on a ramp and pit plate.  It has three basic sections - the gatehouse, the jailhouse tower and the kitchens with the backdoor.  The gatehouse is magnificient.  A wheeled drawbridge and a manual porticullis is built into 4 levels of the tower.  There aren't too much details on the inside, but it looks great from the outside.  The jailhouse tower is just a normal tower with a door on the 2nd level to the back of the gatehouse.  It has no lock though which is really bad design.  A similar tower without a door lies diagonally opposite the jailhouse tower, but this one has no features.  The kitchen has a cool design - it's basically a cantelevered platform with some chairs and a bench and a loft where the treasure is stored.  It is visually appealing as well thanks to the painted yellow wall bricks and the red roof.  The back door though seems a bad idea.  It's not guarded, no locks, nothing and it just opens out to allow anyone to just waltz into the castle.  A really bad idea.

author: OWF
title: The best Castle ever made
review:
Comparing with all other castles, I'm sure this is the most realistic one.
Not as big and impressive as Royal Knights castle, and not as beautiful as King Leo's Castle, this set is the best because of castle structure and minifigs.
Not too small or too big, this set includes over 500 pieces where can be found a great baseplate, beautiful marked walls, 12 minifgs (Cavaliers, archers, ghost) and 4 horses.
This set is the only one where we can find 12 minifigs and 4 horses, usually maximum being 10 minifigs and 3 horses on the most largest sets.

This castle it's elegant and beautiful.

author: aedang
title: Best Castle set ever, and yes it can be upgraded
review:
Best castle set ever, always wanted it as a child, but couldn’t afford, got it on eBay for £90 in its original box, which was a real surprise as I thought I'd have to spend up to £200, guess I just got lucky.

I bought loads of extra bits off bricklink and have made the back tower 4 times taller, the front tower 3 times bigger and the gatehouse double. I also increased the Tudor style section to two floors, making the second floor an armoury. The left side wall and back wall have also be extended to match the other two sides, I plan to get the 6085 - Black Monarch's Castle to use as a gatehouse, maybe a few of them to surround the whole castle.

People who say you can’t expand because of the raised base plate, really aren’t using their imagination. Get this set if you can, worth every penny.

author: mngoult
title: This set is AWESOME, stop reading and go and get it.
review:
Almost lego perfection, certainly the best castle using a raised base plate, and the most asthetically pleasing castle ever.

The minifigs are brilliant almsot all different, the mounted knights look superb when all plumed up and the rest of the men all have a good mixture of weapons. 

The front tower is stunning with brilliant mix of colour and inverted slopes. The door mechanism for the ghosts tower is also a lovely touch. The Castle features hinged section to the dungeon and small living area with table and brilliantly finished by mock tudor wall panals. 

There is a small eascape rout out the back which brings up the only slight glitch with this set. The back is very weak compared to the fron and sides. It features a layer of black then grey bricks which doesn't really work. This should not deter you from picking up this set at any cost, the easiest five stars i've ever given. 

Pros
Cool minifigs and asortmenet of bardings and weapons.
Brilliant front tower with improved portcullis.
Lovely mix of colours and use of tudor style panals.
Lots of hidden sections and nice living area.

Cons
just the back section, thats it. 
Oh and the grey bits that the portcullis slides down look messy on the side of the tower.

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's Review
review:
This castle is debatably the finest ever realised by LEGO, even though the raised plate is disapproved by some, it is still one of the most interesting, largest and coolest looking castles around. Let’s add up the points on this set.

Point 1 the style: The nice mix of black and grey bricks keeps the castle looking good without over doing it; the flashes of red roof and yellowed wall panel add a nice variation to the colour scheme as does the green from the baseplate itself.

Point two the extras: The huge number of extra items add some great play value to the set, we see twelve figs, all of a good variety (a Wolfpack and a ghost), four horses, multiple weapons, two types of shield, barding, armour, visor styled helms, cloaks, a chest, a barrel, a ladder, multiple lanterns, a goblet, multiple flags, the new single mould portcullis, multiple dragon plumes and the unique white dragon plume, and the unique large dragon flag (that’s a long list). 

Point three the play value: The extra hidden play value to the set adds a lot, we have a drawbridge and portcullis, a hidden exit, a ghost’s tower, a well and underground prison as well as the home styled yellowed structure on the side of the castle, there’s just a lot to do.

 I think this is one of the best castles TLG has ever produced, the design is just incredible and it makes the set look so unique. There are plenty of minifigs with it but every fig is also different (even if it’s just in some minor way), you also receive lots of accessories, rare pieces and great playability, this set is as close to perfect as LEGO could get, it’s a shame they took this brilliant raised plate idea and used it so poorly in future sets (which will be explored in future articles), it’s clear LEGO knew what they were doing, yet chose not to repeat the perfect formula.

On an interesting side note this set was originally called Dungeon Master's Castle, so it is possible that these more modern knights could have been a splinter group from the original (the Black Knights splintered to become Dungeon Masters); however this is just speculation and the name was changed rather quickly, still it’s interesting to see how LEGO evolves (first a Dungeon Masters set and then in the following year a Dragon Masters Faction).

If you like this review or if you wish to see images of alternate builds for this set and other sets for this faction click on the link to find it and all reviews of the Castle sets

http://legosteveblog.blogspot.com/2011/11/lego-black-knights-sets-1988-1993.html

author: Pedro_Furlanetto
title: Black Knight's Masterpiece
review:
...and a Lego Group masterpiece too. this castle is for sure the most brilliant released by Lego, each fit is a great event, brick to brick. I think this set reveals the spirit of  real old castles made by the old engineers, this theory are endorsed by the old ghost in the tower that keep the mystic aura of faction. The castle turns more real with the two yellow walls with red roof at the left side and the gap inside the walls of castle. 

          The minifigures are great cause we have the 6009 - Black Knight in yellow plumes and dragon bard and a unique minifigure with white plumes that's so hard to find on a dragon bard too!          

           We have an wolfpack's prince too, you can see it by the red cape in his back. We have the red heads warrior too with their red beards . We have a lot of shields, weapons, 2 yellow goblets and a unique dragon flag! 

           This set is fabulous, mythical and legendary!
